casebody.data:
(July 6, 1954.)

(Republished.)

Feshbach & Ackerman Fur Corp., Respondent, v. Fidelity and Deposit Company of Maryland, Appellant (8175)

Judgment unanimously modified by reducing the verdict to $13,207, on the ground that the jury inadvertently included items relating to skins left after the burglary, as is shown by their reference to “ the sum mentioned in column 9 ” of Exhibit A and, as so modified, affirmed, with costs. (8176) Order unanimously reversed and the motion granted with costs. See decision in Appeal No. 8175. Present — Dore, J. P., Cohn, Callahan, Bastow and Botein, JJ. [See 283 App. Div. 1047.]
